projects.title: From Rock to Gold - Giving minestone a second life
projects.description: With the five of us, Dirk-Jan, Maud, Xinxin and Zate, in the course of two months a report was made as a form of Academic Consultancy Training under the supervision of Cor Langeveld and Rene Rietra, commissioned by Richard de la Roy and Jos Corten. The re-usability of 'Minestone' (unused and prehistorically light polluted rock layers) was assessed. The results were positive and several future alternatives for this 'waste' material were proposed by our team. Currently the project is under investigation for further development (By Richard and Jos) and a first possible project, the Mijn-Wijn, is being proposed as a Cradle to Cradle product (level Gold) for the municipality Parkstad.

projects.title: Quest for the Holy Grail
projects.description:
At the Student association KSV St. Franciscus there is a group of particularly active students in a 'dispuut' "The Knights of the Round Table". This group has many noble purposes, but by far the most important, is the Quest for the Grail. 
All the rest is known only as 'Holy'.

Oke, true, I also did some committees for KSV St. Franciscus. Introduction, Photography, Cooking, First Aid and some taskgroups. Mainly I liked the people, and the beers.

projects.title: Cultura Anguli - Liber legendus omnibus quique omnes libros alios inutiles facit
projects.description:
Writing and publishing the book with an enthousiastic group of 5, led to a beautiful but diffcult and hilarious book.

The publisher; " Het boek is geschreven in hoogstaand en soms zelfs archaïsch Nederlands, maar toch verveelt het niet of nauwelijks, door de humoristische en brutale stijl. Met vele klassieke invloeden weet Cultura Anguli de lezer uur na uur te boeien, met als hoogtepunten de 'Slag bij Paarlo' en de 'Ab Paarlone Condita'.

Antwoorden van buitenstaanders op de vraag "Wat vindt u van Cultura Anguli": 
"Prettig gestoord." – dhr. G Knops 
"Ik heb er geen woorden voor, zo mooi." – Bart Moris" 

 A sequel should currently be in progress (Limburgse mythen en sagen)

projects.title: Masterclass Coilgun
projects.description: Designing and building a record shattering coilgun at the Technical University of Eindhoven (TU/e). Using physics, mathematics and basic electronics to create a multistage electromagnetic projectile accelerator cooled with liquid nitrogen.

profile_positions.description: As an advisor for the soil desk we make thorough analyses about local soil situations. By doing so we are able to accurately predict the state of the soil and predict possible safety/health issues for the engineering crews. This way we contribute to a stable and high quality cable infrastructure (gas, electricity etc.) in the Netherlands.

profile_positions.description:
Hydrogeology of Veluwe
Researching the effects of land use (change) and climate (change) on GWT. Performing fieldwork and historic data comparison of deep (20-400+m) groundwater temperatures. In cooperation with Vitens.
Using vast datasets I created new methods of analysis to reveal the interplay of variables and for example show the general flow direction or effects of land use (change) on groundwater.
Field work and creating the measurement devices between sep-dec 2016. Analysing and writing between mar-jun 2019. Sickness in between.
profile_positions.title: MSc Thesis Student (HWM)

profile_positions.description: Very diverse work; Promoting during open days or assisting at practicals. Helping at and facilitating the start up of the Honours Programme (also content wise on the topic of intelligence and freedom). Facilitating part of the courses 'Presentation Skills'​ and 'Argumentation Skills'​, 'Earth System Science', 'Hydrogeology'. Creating part of the scripts for the MOOC SWA. Aiding PhD research with fieldwork and more. Assisting at/facilitating of seminars and conferences such as the "Wageningen Soil Conference 2015".
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

profile_positions.location: Skottahytta, Svalbard; Wageningen, NL; Poznan, Poland
profile_positions.description:
Doing a research Thesis with the Soil, Geography and Landscape group. Fieldwork is done together with Marijn van der Meij (Wur Student) and with the help and supervision of Dr. Arnaud Temme (WUR) and the department of geomorphology of the Adam Mickiewicz University, Poznan. 
The goal of my thesis is to do "a process based assessment on soil formation and characteristics in the center of Spitsbergen"​ (Skottahytte, 5km from Piramiden). Soil forming factors are looked for and quantified in both a spatial and temporal scale.
Results presented in European Geosciences Union General Assembly 2015, Vienna | Austria | 12 – 17 April 2015
http://meetingorganizer.copernicus.org/EGU2015/EGU2015-14579.pdf
Research was published; http://www.arctichub.net/resources/2426
profile_positions.title: MSc Thesis Student (SGL)

volunteer_experiences.description:
Making the circus possible before, during and after the show, mainly backstage, sometimes as part of the show.
Typical work includes mainly making and repairing the decor and helping the artists (perform).
Due to disputable governmental legislation, circusses around the country are going bankrupt in a ridiculously fast pace. Unfortunately in June 2016 it was our turn.

A staff position in the scouting is a leaderposition with a tremendous amount of freedom to be able to teach the kids nearly anything you can think of, from building a floating catapult to making fire with sticks and from doing maintenance on boats to sailing down the country. That is, if you can keep their attention long enough when they're quite.

http://www.waterscouts-franciscus.nl/

As story tellers we emerge people in the full scala of emotions. We speak about the legends of old, about own experiences, about typically but weird Dutch uses, how stress affected us and we dealt with it, how we nearly died or what #me2 can feel like and much much more. Taboos are no problems, laughter and getting mentally swept of your feet are common. We, are entertainers, and we love it!
Founding Acrobatics Aport Association 'Op de Kop' Utrecht.

APECS Netherlands is the Dutch national committee of the Association of Polar Early Career scientists (APECS): an international and interdisciplinary organization for undergraduate and graduate students, postdoctoral researchers, early faculty members, educators and others with interests in Polar Regions and the wider cryosphere. APECS Netherlands organizes and joins symposia, workshops and outreach events in the Netherlands and provides a platform for networking, education, outreach and career development for polar early career researchers.

For more information on what APECS can do for you or what you can do for APECS, visit www.apecsnl.wordpress.com

My role is to make APECS NL an officially recognized organisation within the Netherlands.

Chairman of Red Cross Department Renkum-Wageningen from 4-nov-2013/15-jun-2017.
Together with an enthusiastic board we guided the department. My focus was with the people, teamwork and communication, as a chairman, board member Self-Reliance and some PR/External communication (until summer 2015). The board implemented the changes of the Red Cross such as creating self-reliance (zelfredzaamheid) and focusing more on emergency aid. This included a large guiding and managing role with over 15 voluntary organisations, the municipality and companies. With Amy in 't Groen and Pim van Asch we founded the WelkomWinkelWageningen for clothing distribution to refugees, in cooperation with as many local voluntary organisations as possible. 
Furthermore I had a role to play in founding the studentdesk of Wageningen, done by Yu-Sha Vergeer and Ida Rademaker.

First aider according to Orange and Red Cross standards.
Application during minor and major events such as the dutch Fifth of may and Queensday.
http://www.rodekruis.nl/afdeling/renkum-wageningen/paginas/afdeling.aspx

Also Emergency Response Officer (BHV+EHBO, full certificate) at Forum, Orion, Gaia and Transitorium (WUR) january 2010-march 2020
Active in politics during sickness-induced study-sabbatical.

In january 2012 Lacrosse started as a sport in Wageningen. A small group of enthousiasts decided to found an association. In the board thereof my function was to achieve the status of acknowledged association for the Wageningen Warriors. The Wageningse Studenten Lacrosse Vereniging 'Wageningen Warriors' is now an acknowledged and thriving students sports association with already some competition teams and many members.

Board member of study association Pyrus;
Commissionar of Study for the Pyrus boards 21b & 22a (2010). 
As the StuCo I was responsible for all study related affairs for Pyrus. It included meetings with educational committees and teachers, informing students and teachers about each others opinions and improving the quality of education via several other processes.
I have also been actively involved in numerous other ways, f.e. in dozens of committees.
